title: Domain 2.8: Given a scenario, use common data destruction and disposal methods.
content:
🧨 Physical Destruction

For permanent and unrecoverable data destruction:

  • 🛠️ Drilling: Physically punctures storage to destroy data platters or chips.
  • ✂️ Shredding: Reduces storage devices into small pieces using an industrial shredder.
  • 🧲 Degaussing: Applies strong magnetic fields to erase magnetic media (like HDDs).
  • 🔥 Incinerating: Burns storage media into ash to eliminate all data.

🔁 Recycling or Repurposing Best Practices

  • 🧹 Erasing/Wiping: Overwrites all data to prevent recovery.
  • 🧼 Low-Level Formatting: Reinitializes the storage device, removing data and file structures.
  • 🧾 Standard Formatting: Deletes file pointers but may leave recoverable data — not secure on its own.

🧾 Outsourcing Concepts

  • 👷 Third-Party Vendor: Trusted providers specialize in secure data and hardware disposal.
  • 📜 Certification of Destruction/Recycling: Legal documentation proving proper data disposal.
